reviews.comment: Decent. The way she explains stuff can be confusing at times but she does not make the assignments and exams too difficult.

Her explanation of the concepts were easy to understand. She answers questions clearly in class, in office hours and on piazza. The slides were helpful and accessible. She is friendly and supportive of students.

Lectures might be boring if you aren't interested in the content, but if you are interested in the content they are pretty informative. Doesn't explain the syntax of the language (Java), but most people taking this class should be able to pick it up pretty quickly. Explains the majority of the content quite well, except for UML diagrams.

She is really good at deciphering what students are asking about. Some students are not good at communicating, but Meghan is very effective at helping students regardless. I am not suggesting you can just throw any questions at her, but be most comfortable asking her questions. Appreciated her effort to see from the students' perspectives.

Definitely recommend Meghan. She is very caring. I felt lost here and there, but Meghan was always there and caught my exceptions. Really appreciate a devoted professor like her, and wish we have more prof like her

Meghan is quite literally the best prof I've ever had. This is my second time with her and I'm glad. Caring, understanding and good lecturer. She cares more about her students than any other prof and will even motivate you if you're having a bad day. She's easy to open up to. UBC is lucky to have her. She's impacted my life forever and she knows it

It was a privilege having Meghan again for a second time. No one will ever compare. She is caring, genuine, patient, nurturing, gentle and truly one of a kind. She gives so much of herself to help her students. She remembered me by name from last time, and still in a class 200. Not enough words to illustrate the impact she's had on me. Unparalleled

Meghan's pace during the lecture is fantastic. She tries her best to make sure students understand the material by keeping a steady pace. I appreciate that because I would have otherwise gotten lost. She is also a very caring professor. Go to her office hour and you will see what I mean!

Once again, she is the greatest prof I have ever known. I took 103 with her and learned so much; I was surprised how much 103 had taught me and allowed me to take on a large project. Now I am taking 210 with her. Meghan is extremely caring, understands that students go through hard times. Admit it, she deserves 5/5.

I can't stress enough how amazing Meghan is. Zero regrets taking her class. She's the reason I'm switching my major into compsci. I owe a lot to her. She is a rare gem. Great feedback, clear lectures, accommodating. Above and beyond the norm. One of the most helpful and considerate people I've ever met. More like a mom who's also badass at coding.

Dr. Allen is an angel. She is caring, pays attention to her students' needs and listens to feedback. She takes her time thoroughly explaining lecture content and answering questions. Incredibly empathetic to the difficulty of the course and will help to as much as she can (accessible outside of class). She made CPSC so fun and interesting.

If you have coded before from self learning, this is your chance to get organized and write codes properly. Not only that CPSC103 is extremely useful course in general, but Meghan's teaching is very effective. She constantly takes feedbacks and even goes well over her office hour to answer your question. Dedicated, caring, intelligent, best prof.

During this pandemic, she really made an effort to provide a fair structure for this course. There were a lot of problems with Jupyter during midterms and she took that into consideration and scaled accordingly. She created group labs to get us to interact with other students in the course because we can't do that from the pandemic.

Meghan was an excellent professor. She put aside time to do "Mentimeter" Q&A time where we could ask her questions during the lecture. She was also accessible outside of class, through a website called Piazza. Whenever I had a question, I could submit it to Piazza and it would be answered in minutes by her or TAs! Awesome prof - would recommend.

Great prof. Very responsive to student feedback and constantly trying to make the course better. She was very quick to give me feedback when I had questions even in a class of 300. Definitely would recommend!

Due to the size of the class, its not always possible to interact with her directly. But she has always been very accommodating (participation not required and more). Marks cut for absolutely everything. Unexpected grades for most people.

Dr. Allen is a caring and brilliant professor. She is extremely patient and makes sure everyone understands the material. She encourages you to see from a different perspective and genuinely wants students to be successful. I am very grateful that I took Dr. Allen's course on introduction to programming.

Great prof with solid knowledge of the subject matter. There are many components to the course so you need to be able to keep up and be ready to pay attention. Good course otherwise and can provide solid foundational knowledge.

While she isn't the most charismatic, she does a good job of explaining relatively complex concepts in the most uncomplicated way possible. The examples she uses in class really help grasp concepts as well. She does use a lot of formal 'compsci' language, so there are times I wish she would explain it as if I were 5 years old.

Meghan was a solid prof. I went into CPSC 103 with no coding background and did relatively well in the class. Lectures were a bit pointless, but I found the assignments, labs, and project to be effective. Both midterms were straight forward, and you should do well as long as you complete the practice exams. Would take again!

As part of my program requirements I had to take cpsc 103 with her and as a person not in science with no computer science background this course was very difficult and she didn't give in much effort in explaining. She kinda assumes you already know. The class was mostly self study.

I liked her teaching. I think the content of the course is just super difficult to grasp but the way she executed it in lecture made sense to me most of the time. She answers questions well and is super helpful. Yes her voice is a bit monotone so it's easy to lose focus. I say just watch the tutorials before class, show up, listen and you're good.
Talks way too fast and never slows down.

I was interested in computer science after  taking CPSC 101. However, this course is almost the exact opposite. What I found interesting in CPSC 101 was nowhere to be seen. It is way too time consuming. There are so many videos to watch in order to prepare for class. The lectures are pretty much useless except for the clicker marks.

She is a good instructor, she comes prepared for the class but at times I wished she just loosened up and forgot the lecture notes. As her lectures tends to become very monotonous, and her tone doesn't help her case either. I just found her to be not engaging enough to maintain student's interest. Otherwise she knows the material, helpful and fair.
She is very good. Compare to Gregor. Her explanation is ver clear and easy to understand. I think she is a really good prof.

Meghan really tries to reach out and when you ask for help she is super nice. The course itself is boring, and you will probably focus most on labs, but I think overall it was ok. Like most people said, just read the slides and google things you need to know.
Can tell that she tries to teach. just that the speed and the way she teach isnt good enough.

When I took CPSC 110, I had to make up my lecture by going to another section.. and it happened to be hers. I lost interest in like 2 minutes... same in CPSC 210. When she explains a material i'd go.. HUH? I learn my stuff mostly from TA and reading.

Pretty good as a lecture prof but didn't have much of a presence outside of class. Her office hours, though difficult to get, are useful and should be sought after. Pretty interesting course, though she dealt more with the theory behind it and left the TAs to explain the labs/projects better.
Great use of the online materials. Good prof. I am excited to have her again for higher level classes.
deadlines get confusing and second midterm will kill you but you will learn important material
Taught way too fast and didn't give helpful information to solve problems.

CPSC 110 was a very demanding course, especially during the summer. A lot of material to learn in just 6 weeks. She was super nice though. She seemed prepared before each class. Answered in-class questions satisfactorily. Exams were fair, labs were at times tough but you get a lot of help from the TA's, problem sets were a bit brutal.

There's no way she deserves any positive comments. Not helpful, not clear. Transform an easy first year course into a hellish deadline marathon. Makes fun of students on discussion board by linking them back to the academic honesty page. Even if it was just a simple yes/no question. Horrific.
Not helpful at all. Only posts "@85." on the discussion boards, which links the student back to the Academic Honesty page. Absolutely terrible.

Good prof. Replies very quickly on discussion board. However, the course is taught way too quickly and it is difficult to enjoy the material. There are so much supplemental videos/notes to read before class it really makes it difficult to have any other kind of life outside of school. Not recommended if you actually want to enjoy summer.
Her classes are ok. but beware for summer school she goes really really fast and her examples dont go very deep to be able to do the homework.

Teaches at a good pace. Very kind and considerate of students. It's important to take notes during her lectures because she has no notes outside of the reading materials. Quite helpful during office hours.

Not the most interesting class, but Meghan was very clear and easy to understand given the (pretty dull) material she had to teach. The midterm & final was easy if you read her slides and google necessary concepts.

Her lectures are..... just... BORING as hell...... And bit useless too.... Just read slides and google about each process... I dont even think she knows what to teach? There were some random focuses on little stuffs too.... And she's not like that much of a fair mark so.... Attendance is bit mandatory cuz of the class activity....

Dont take any courses with meghan! Lectures are super boring, slides are useless doesnt write any note during the class just talks. doesnt provide solution for sample midterms/finals. its not clear what she wants from u

She's pretty cool; if she doesn't know how to help with the project she redirects you to someone who does and her classes are clear albeit not always the most interesting if you don't like to memorise, but otherwise her advice and tasks are pretty well-organised and well-executed

I think Meghan is a great prof. She was very helpful with any questions I had, in office hours or by email. She really does care if you understand the material. Her tests were hard, but definitely not as hard as they could have been. I would recommend taking one of her classes!
I don't think she should be teaching any courses at all
Meghan doesnt answer questions and what she teaches is practically useless. This course is a major headache for any students that hates memorizing.
Meg is nice, however she can't teach, doesn't know the material, and cannot answer questions.  Her projects are poorly put together, and she can't help with them because she barely understands them.

Meghan is an insanely nice teacher and is so compassionate and understanding. Her slides, however, are not very useful. Make sure you attend the javascript lectures and fully understand them and youll do fine, the rest is common sense.

She is probably the nicest computer science instructor.  However, she is not strong in the area of teaching.  She just reads of her slides in class.  She cannot answer questions about the slides or about the subject in general if the answer is not evident in the slides.

She's a nice prof but mostly just regurgitate what the slides say (and it's not her slides). Doesn't seem very confident about her lecture material. A lot of class activities (counts for 10%). The course itself is pretty useless and just requires common sense. Midterm and final were both easy. The project will require ALOT of time.
easy but extremely boring. She's very helpful and easy to talk to. i didn't learn much from the course thou

Hated class but still did well.  I'm a 4th year student interested in subject and  knew more than she did in areas outside of core topics (ie  she couldn't answer questions I asked) She's helpful and is extremely accessible outside of class; but sticks tightly to script and doesnt explain difficult topics well. Notes become useless for tests later.

She's nice,answers questions,interact with students .Some easy concepts became complicated...I don't enjoy the in-class exercises because - although there is a whole bunch of instructions but we aren't clear of what we should do.WMST201 is combined with Cpsc101 and we haven't talked about any thing that is related to women studies yet.
Megan is an effective communicator. She is intelligent and thoroughly understands the material. She is helpful when problems arise. She is good at enforcing respectful behavior in the classroom.
Very articulate and knowledgable. Always helpful. Class pace was good.
Meghan is a good instructor. I've had her in 121 and 211, and she continues to get better and gain confidence in teaching. She is very considerate of her students.

Meghan honestly doesn't get enough credit for all that she does for the students. She's considerate, helpful, and always willing to hold more office hours to help you out with any questions. I chose to take both CPSC 211 and 121 with her, and am so glad I did.

She doesn't know anything other than what is written on the notes.  If you ask any question she'll always say "I'll check", but rarely does.  She's more like a TA than a prof. Try to get into the other sections if possible.

She was incredibly helpful and explained the concepts really well that I still remember the material she taught me! If you can, enroll in her section. Her exams are very fair and she's quite considerate of her students!
She's a really great prof, i'm glad i'll have her again.
